article.headline: UMKC 70, Centenary 67
article.story: SHREVEPORT, La. (AP) -- Tim Blackwell scored 25 to lead UMKC to a 70-67 win over Centenary Saturday. Blackwell was 8-of-13 from the field, 6-of-10 from 3-point range and made three free throws. Quinton Day added 23 points for the Kangaroos (9-10, 5-3 Mid-Continent). Day was 7-of-18 from the field, sank three 3-pointers and was a perfect 6-of-6 from the free-throw line. Chris Watson led the Gents (4-16, 2-7) with 21 points and Alexander Starr added 15. UMKC led 40-28 at the half, and Centenary battled back in the second, outscoring the Kangaroos 39-30. The Gents were down just one point with 1:18 left, but after a series of missed jumped shots, Blackwell hit both of his free throws with six seconds remaining to seal the victory for the Kangaroos.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
